'''Nidoran♂''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ニドラン♂''' ''Nidoran♂'') is a {{type|Poison}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation I]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] into {{p|Nidorino}} starting at [[level]] 16, which evolves into {{p|Nidoking}} when exposed to a [[Moon Stone]].

It is related to {{p|Nidoran♀}} and, starting in [[Generation V]], can produce {{pkmn|Egg}}s that contain either Nidoran♂ or Nidoran♀ when [[Pokémon breeding|bred]] with {{p|Ditto}}.

==Biology==
Nidoran♂ is a small, quadruped rodent-like Pokémon. It is pinkish purple with darker spots, and has large, spiny ears with teal insides, oversized front teeth, and red eyes. Its back is covered with three lines of large spines that can release potent poisons if threatened. The center line of spines is taller than the other two. The size of the long, pointed horn on its forehead is indicative of the strength of its venom. Nidoran♂ is an exclusively male Pokémon, {{p|Nidoran♀}} being its female counterpart.

Nidoran♂ constantly listens for the sounds of approaching enemies with its large ears. Said ears have unique muscles that allow them to be moved in any direction, and even the slightest sound does not escape Nidoran♂'s notice. In order to listen to distant locations, it flaps its ears like wings. When angry, it extends its toxic spikes and charges, stabbing with its horn to inject poison. Nidoran♂ lives in open spaces, such as {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Grassland Pokémon|savannas and plains}}.

====Major appearances====
{{OBP|Ralph|EP100}} owned a Nidoran♂, which evolved into a Nidorino after kissing {{OBP|Emily|EP100}}'s Nidoran♀ in ''[[EP100|Wherefore Art Thou, Pokémon?]]''.

In ''[[DP109|Leading a Stray!]]'', one was part of a {{p|Luxio}}'s group.

====Minor appearances====
Nidoran♂ debuted in ''[[EP028|Pokémon Fashion Flash]]''.

A Nidoran♂ appeared in ''[[EP057|The Breeding Center Secret]]''.

A group of {{Shiny}} (due to a coloring error) Nidoran♂ were seen at Professor Oak's Laboratory in ''[[EP065|Showdown at the Po-ké Corral]]''.

A Nidoran♂ appeared in ''[[EP073|Bad to the Bone]]'', under the ownership of an unnamed Trainer.

A differently patterned Nidoran♂ appeared in ''[[EP083|Poké Ball Peril]]''.

A {{DL|List of alternately colored Pokémon in the anime|Pink Pokémon|pink}} Nidoran♂ appeared in [[EP088|In the Pink]]. {{TRT}} tried to capture him along with his female counterpart until a {{DL|List of alternately colored Pokémon in the anime|Pink Nidoking|pink}} {{p|Nidoking}} chased them off.

A Nidoran♂ appeared in ''[[M02|The Power of One]]''.

A Nidoran♂ and a Nidoran♀ were cuddling behind a bush in ''[[EP126|The Chikorita Rescue]]''.

A Nidoran♂ briefly appeared along with a Nidoran♀ in ''[[EP143|Going Apricorn!]]'' at [[Professor Oak's Laboratory]], where they were being fed by {{Tracey}}.

A Nidoran♂ was one of the Pokémon stolen by [[Butch]] and [[Cassidy]] in ''[[EP157|The Fortune Hunters]]''.

A Nidoran♂ appeared in ''[[M04|Celebi: The Voice of the Forest]]''.

A Nidoran couple were among the inhabitants of the [[Dragon Holy Land]] in ''[[EP252|Fangs for Nothin']]''.

A Nidoran♂ was one of the Pokémon seen at [[Professor Oak's Laboratory]] in ''[[SS004|Showdown at the Oak Corral]]''.

Multiple Nidoran♂ appeared in the opening sequence of ''[[M07|Destiny Deoxys]]''.

A Nidoran♂ appeared in ''[[M08|Lucario and the Mystery of Mew]]'' as one of the Pokémon living in the [[Tree of Beginning]].

A Nidoran♂ appeared in ''[[DP071|Pokémon Ranger and the Kidnapped Riolu! Part One]]''.

Multiple Nidoran♂ made a cameo in ''[[M12|Arceus and the Jewel of Life]]''.

A Nidoran♂ appeared in [[Evolution|Cilan's demonstration]] in ''[[BW135|Mystery on a Deserted Island!]]'', where he evolved into a Nidoking.

A Nidoran♂ appeared in ''[[XY008|Grooming Furfrou!]]''.

A Nidoran♂ appeared in a flashback or a fantasy in ''[[XY035|The Forest Champion!]]''.

Multiple Nidoran♂ appeared in ''[[M17|Diancie and the Cocoon of Destruction]]''.

A Nidoran♂ appeared in ''[[PK27|Pikachu and the Pokémon Music Squad]]''.

A Nidoran♂ appeared in ''[[XY108|A Watershed Moment!]]'' in a flashback.

A Trainer's Nidoran♂ appeared in ''[[SM001|Alola to New Adventure!]]'' during a flashback.

A Nidoran♂ appeared in ''[[SM003|Loading the Dex!]]'' as a silhouette that [[Rotom Pokédex]] brought up.

A Nidoran♂ appeared in ''[[M20|I Choose You!]]''.

===In the [[Pokémon Adventures]] manga===
Nidoran♂ first he appeared in ''[[PS039|Just a Spearow Carrier]]'' belonging to [[Wilton]]. {{adv|Green}} attempted to trick the man into trading his {{p|Butterfree}} for her weak {{p|Weedle}} because his Pokémon was infatuated with her {{DL|Green (Adventures)|Nidory|female Nidoran}}. {{adv|Red}} was able to stop her from carrying out this plan, however.

Another Nidoran♂ appeared in ''[[PS179|The Last Battle XIII]]'' as one of the Pokémon sent to help the fight in [[Ilex Forest]].

===In the Pokémon Gotta Catch 'Em All manga===
[[Shu]] has a Nidoran♂ in the [[Pokémon Gotta Catch 'Em All]] manga.

===In the Pokémon Zensho manga===
{{Zensho|Satoshi}} catches a Nidoran♂ in ''[[PZ04|Vermilion City]]''. However, Nidoran♂ turns out to be [[Bill]] in the end.

==Trivia==
* Nidoran was the first Pokémon to feature gender differences, and even gender; however, their difference is much greater than most later Pokémon.
* Despite the addition of genders in all Pokémon starting in Generation II, the two variations of Nidoran remained separate species, rather than a singular species that splits down different evolution paths based on gender.
** When an {{pkmn|Egg}} is produced from Nidoran and Ditto parents, the gender ratio of the Egg favors the gender of the non-Ditto parent by an unknown margin.
** A Nidoran♀ {{pkmn|Egg}} has a chance of hatching into a Nidoran♂ when bred with a non-Nidoran♂ compatible father.
* Nidoran♂'s {{pkmn2|Shiny|alternate coloration}} is similar to {{p|Nidoran♀}}'s normal coloration. The same goes for Nidoran♀ .
* Nidoran♂ shares its {{pkmn|category}} name with {{p|Nidorino}}, {{p|Nidoran♀}}, {{p|Nidorina}}, {{p|Poipole}}, and {{p|Naganadel}}. They are all known as the Poison Pin Pokémon.
* Due to the fact that its gender, ♂, is included in its name, checking Nidoran♂'s summary from [[Generation II]] onward will display as if it were genderless if it does not have a nickname. If its nickname is anything other than "Nidoran♂", its gender will appear as normal.
* Nidoran♂ is the only Pokémon with a base stat total of 273.

===Origin===
Nidoran♂ appears to be based on a {{wp|porcupine}}, {{wp|rabbit}}, {{wp|mouse}}, or a {{wp|hamster}}, as seen by their aggressive nature towards one another.

====Name origin====
Nidoran♂ may be derived from ''needle''. It may also come from ''{{wp|cnidocyte}}'', a type of venomous cell responsible for the stings delivered by stinging animals, most notably jellyfish. Alternatively, it may be based on 二 ''ni'' (two) or 二度 ''nido'' (two times/two degrees) referring to the two distinct evolutionary lines with similar names and traits. Also, the Japanese word ''ran'' is translated as ''orchid'' in English. {{wp|Orchid}}s are flowers that can be purple or blue, these being the same colors as the male and female evolutionary forms of Nidoran, respectively. The ''♂'' is an indication of its male gender.
